mozilla.components.browser.search.provider.localization

Class LocaleSearchLocalizationProvider

  • SearchLocalizationProvider
    • mozilla.components.browser.search.provider.localization.LocaleSearchLocalizationProvider

  • public class LocaleSearchLocalizationProvider
extends SearchLocalizationProvider

    LocalizationProvider implementation that only provides the language and country from the system's default languageTag.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LocaleSearchLocalizationProvider()
      LocalizationProvider implementation that only provides the language and country from the system's default languageTag.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getCountry()
      ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code or UN M.49 numeric-3 area code.
      java.lang.String getLanguage()
      ISO 639 alpha-2 or alpha-3 language code, or registered language subtags up to 8 alpha letters (for future enhancements).
      java.lang.String getRegion()
      Optional actual location (region only) of the user/device. ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code or UN M.49 numeric-3 area code.

      • Methods inherited from class mozilla.components.browser.search.provider.localization.SearchLocalizationProvider

        getCountry, getLanguage, getLanguageTag, getRegion

    • Constructor Detail

      • LocaleSearchLocalizationProvider

        public LocaleSearchLocalizationProvider()

        LocalizationProvider implementation that only provides the language and country from the system's default languageTag.

    • Method Detail

      • getLanguage

        public java.lang.String getLanguage()

        ISO 639 alpha-2 or alpha-3 language code, or registered language subtags up to 8 alpha letters (for future enhancements).

        Example: "en" (English), "ja" (Japanese), "kok" (Konkani)

      • getCountry

        public java.lang.String getCountry()

        ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code or UN M.49 numeric-3 area code.

        Example: "US" (United States), "FR" (France), "029" (Caribbean)

      • getRegion

        public java.lang.String getRegion()

        Optional actual location (region only) of the user/device. ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code or UN M.49 numeric-3 area code.

        This value is used to customize the experience for users that use a languageTag that doesn't match their geographic region. For example a user in Russia with "en-US" languageTag might get offered an English version of Yandex if the region is set to "RU".

        Can be null if no location information is available.
